sentence.Network_en: He spent the last fourteen years of his life in retirement.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一生中最后的14年是在退休中度过的。

sentence.Network_en: The term "early retirement" is nearly always a euphemism for redundancy nowadays.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在“提前退休”几乎就是裁员的委婉说法。

sentence.Network_en: The New York Times has this very laudatory article about your retirement.
sentence.Network_cn: 《纽约时报》发文谈及你的隐退，文中对你大加赞扬。

entry.def: Retirement is the time when a worker retires.

example.ex: ...the proportion of the population who are over retirement age...
example.tran: 超过退休年龄的人口比例

example.ex: The Governor of the prison and another official are to take early retirement.
example.tran: 这个监狱的监狱长和另外一个官员将会提前退休。

entry.def: A person's retirement is the period in their life after they have retired.

example.ex: ...financial support for the elderly during retirement.
example.tran: 为退休期间的老年人提供的经济支持

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being retired from one's business or occupation
2. withdrawal from your position or occupation
3. withdrawal for prayer and study and meditation;

Sentence.sentence: After all, existing jobs open up every day due to promotions, resignations, terminations（解雇）, and retirements.
Postponing doing what you love and being with people you love until retirement can be a mistake.
Retirement can be a great time for some people
He has already reached the retirement age.

sentences.en: She took to painting after retirement.
We’ve had two retirements in our office this year.
sentences.cn: 今年我们办公室已有二人退休。

sentences.en: He lives in retirement, away from everyone.
